question: Renewable resources can be naturally replenished over time.
Non-renewable resources can be replaced quickly after they are used.
Solar energy is a non-renewable resource.
Wind energy is considered a renewable resource.
Coal is a non-renewable resource because it takes millions of years to form.
Water is an example of a cyclic resource because it can be reused through the water cycle.
Gold and silver are renewable resources.
Forests can be classified as renewable resources if they are replanted after cutting trees.
Petroleum is a cyclic resource.
Oxygen and carbon dioxide are cyclic resources because they are continuously exchanged between plants and animals.
Fossil fuels, such as coal and oil, are formed in a short period of time.
Hydropower is generated using renewable water resources.
Plastic is a renewable resource because it can be recycled.
Non-renewable resources can be exhausted if overused.
Geothermal energy is a type of renewable resource.
Cyclic resources can be reused after going through natural or artificial processes.
Metal ores such as iron and aluminum can be classified as cyclic resources when they are recycled.
Agricultural crops are non-renewable resources.
Uranium is used in nuclear power plants and is a renewable resource.
Deforestation affects the availability of renewable resources like forests and wildlife.
Recycling helps conserve non-renewable resources by reducing waste.
Once metals are extracted from the Earth, they can never be reused.
Water can be classified as both a renewable and cyclic resource.
Natural gas is a renewable resource because it is found in nature.
Cyclic resources help in reducing waste and conserving natural resources.
Wind turbines use fossil fuels to generate electricity.
Hydropower plants use the movement of water to generate electricity.
Petroleum and coal are formed from dead plants and animals over millions of years.
Paper made from trees is a non-renewable resource.
Overuse of fossil fuels contributes to environmental pollution.
Non-renewable resources can be renewed by planting more trees.
Coal mining can cause deforestation and habitat destruction.
Solar panels convert sunlight into electrical energy.
Wind power is generated using non-renewable resources.
Natural resources are important for human survival and industrial growth.
Cyclic resources can never be reused or recycled.
Iron and aluminum can be recycled multiple times without losing their properties.
Water pollution affects the usability of water as a cyclic resource.
Sustainable use of natural resources means using them in a way that preserves them for future generations.
Overconsumption of non-renewable resources will not have any negative impact on the environment.
The burning of fossil fuels releases greenhouse gases into the atmosphere.
Recycling paper helps in reducing deforestation.
Plastic is a cyclic resource because it can be completely broken down naturally.
Forest conservation helps maintain renewable resources like trees and wildlife.
Fossil fuels such as coal and oil are renewable because they are naturally formed underground.
Recycling aluminum cans saves energy and reduces the need for mining.
The use of renewable energy sources helps reduce dependency on fossil fuels.
Sustainable farming ensures that agricultural land remains fertile for future generations.
Deforestation does not affect the water cycle.
Using public transportation can help conserve non-renewable resources like petroleum.
